techniques.comment: The threat actor used Rubeus to conduct a Kerberoasting attack
Rubeus was utilized for AS-REP Roasting on the beachhead host
Access to LSASS memory for obtaining valid credentials was observed
The threat actor executed systeminfo to gather details about the local system
The threat actor used Windows utilities, including systeminfo and nltest, to perform enumeration on the system and environment
Observations of pass-the-hash attacks suggest lateral movement took place. SMB Admin shares and RDP were also used for lateral movement
The attacker used SMB Admin $ shares to move beacons laterally
RDP was used for further lateral movement
Cobalt Strike was used for its capabilities that mimic Sysinternals PsExec for remote process execution
The threat actor modified the registry to enable RDP access to a file server
Cobalt Strike and SystemBC were used for command and control
The actor used 7z to archive data output from running the Get-DataInfo.ps1 PowerShell script
Upon execution, the ransomware used vssadmin to delete shadow copies before encrypting the hosts
